headline: Why The Coursera (COUR) Narrative Is Shifting As Analysts Reset Targets And 2026 Guidance Lands
summary: Coursera’s modeled fair value was revised from US$11.45 to US$10.27, a reduction of about 10.3% in the price target estimate. That move sits alongside a cluster of US$2 to US$3 price target cuts from JPMorgan, Goldman Sachs and others, where bulls and bears are reading the same data very differently. In the sections that follow, you will see how these shifts fit into the evolving Coursera story and how to track the next round of updates with context rather than noise. Analyst Price Targets...

headline: How Shifting Analyst Views Are Rewriting The Story For Snap (SNAP)
summary: Snap’s fair value estimate has been trimmed slightly from US$8.38 to US$8.07, while one major bank’s price target move to US$9.50 and Goldman Sachs’ shift from US$9.50 to US$8.50 capture how divided analysts are at current levels. Those changes sit alongside a series of upgrades and cuts across the Street, reflecting different views on execution risk, monetization, and where a smaller ad platform like Snap should trade. As you read on, you will see how to interpret these moves and keep up...
